info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 07 at 3:46AM EDT until April 07 at 4:15AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN LAURENS...SOUTHEASTERN GREENVILLE AND NORTHEASTERN ANDERSON COUNTIES... At 346 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 13 miles southeast of Greenville Downtown, or 4 miles south of Simpsonville, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Mauldin, Simpsonville, Fountain Inn, Piedmont, West Pelzer, Donaldson Center, Fork Shoals, Williamston, Greenville Eastside and West Greenville. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
